channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DATAMONGO-686] ClassCastException while reusing Query object
item.description:
When I create a query on document _id with $in operator and reuse that query to do another search i get ClassCastException.

Query creation:

query.addCriteria(Criteria.where("_id").in(signedPetitionIds));

Reusing query (as a filterQuery argument):

private Page<PetitionHeader> findPetitionHeaders(Pageable pageable, Query filterQuery, Sort sort) {
 
	long count = mongoOp.count(filterQuery, PetitionHeader.class);
 
	filterQuery.with(pageable);
 
	filterQuery.with(sort);
 
	List<PetitionHeader> headers = mongoOp.find(filterQuery, PetitionHeader.class);
 
	return new PageImpl<PetitionHeader>(headers, pageable, count);
 
}

Stacktrace:

java.lang.ClassCastException: [Ljava.lang.Object; cannot be cast to java.lang.Iterable
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.convert.QueryMapper.getMappedValue(QueryMapper.java:159) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.convert.QueryMapper.getMappedObject(QueryMapper.java:90) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.convert.QueryMapper.getMappedKeyword(QueryMapper.java:112) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.convert.QueryMapper.getMappedObject(QueryMapper.java:79) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.doFind(MongoTemplate.java:1337) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.doFind(MongoTemplate.java:1323) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.find(MongoTemplate.java:495) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]
 
	at org.springframework.data.mongodb.core.MongoTemplate.find(MongoTemplate.java:486) ~[spring-data-mongodb-1.2.1.RELEASE.jar:na]

Object returned by valueDbo.get(inKey) (in line 159) is of type Object[].

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I faced the same issue with the latest version 1.3.3, and had to go back to 1.1.2

Hello,

I gave this a spin but could not reproduce your problem.
Could you please check whether this is still an issue?

This what I tried (in MongoTemplateTests), did I miss something?

	/**
 
	 * @see DATAMONGO-686
 
	 */
 
	@Test
 
	public void itShouldBePossibleToReuseAnExistingQuery() {
 
 
 
		Sample sample = new Sample();
 
		sample.id = "42";
 
		sample.field = "Thomas";
 
 
 
		template.save(sample);
 
 
 
		Query query = new Query();
 
		query.addCriteria(Criteria.where("_id").in("42", "43"));
 
 
 
		assertThat(template.count(query, Sample.class), is(1L));
 
 
 
		query.with(new PageRequest(0, 10));
 
		query.with(new Sort("field"));
 
 
 
		assertThat(template.find(query, Sample.class), is(not(empty())));
 
	}

Cheers
Thomas

A little bit more context would be helpful here, can you tell us when this happens? Does this happen all the time or just occasionally?
Is the query modified between multiple calls to findPetitionHeaders from different threads?

Your test seems to target my problem accurately.
This evening I will look closer into this issue and give you some feedback.

Answers to your questions:

  • Yes it happened all the time.
  • No the query wasn't modified by different threads.

Cheers
Paweł

Thanks for the quick reply and for the effort!
May be you can check this against the latest Spring Data MongoDB BUILD-SNAPSHOT as well
no problem

I spent some time over this issue but I couldn't reproduce this exception All maven dependencies have the same version like in the project where I found the problem, only MongoDB server is newer.

Sorry, next time I will prepare test case before creating jira issue. You can close this ticket.

Cheers,
Paweł

I tried upgrading to 1.3.3.RELEASE, and the error is reproduced. The query giving error is 

	@Query(value="{'_id' : {'$in' : ?0}}",
 
		   fields="{'status': 1, 'descr' : 1, 'executorOid' : 1, 'remindAt' : 1, 'visited' : 1}")
 
	Page<Task> tasksByIds(Set<String> taskIds, Pageable pageable);

But this query is working well:

	@Query(value="{'_id' : {'$in' : ?0}}",
 
			   fields="{'status': 1, 'descr' : 1, 'executorOid' : 1, 'remindAt' : 1, 'visited' : 1}")
 
	List<Task> tasksByIds(Set<String> taskIds);

So, probably the error is coming when Pageable is being used.

Hello Sanjaya,

thanks for the response
Could you give Spring Data Mongo 1.4.0.DATAMONGO-686-SNAPSHOT a spin?
I fixed a potential race condition in QueryMapper that could result in the mentioned ClassCastException being thrown.

Cheers,
Thomas

Hi Thomas,

Thanks. Was I supposed to put 1.4.0.DATAMONGO-686-SNAPSHOT as the version in my pom, and add http://repo.spring.io/snapshot repository? I did that but it says that the artifact is missing. Then, I tried 1.4.0.BUILD-SNAPSHOT, but then faced some errors, must be in my environment or code. I 'll try to give another shot at is soon. This is my stack trace with 1.3.3.RELEASE, if it helps:

Replaced the test with your suggestions please review.

@Sanjaya

We integrated the change into the master branch - it should be available in the snapshots in a bit.
